go has more from Madrid the possibility
of introducing some kind of universal
basic income in Spain has been talked

certainly been accelerated by the
coronavirus crisis which has already had
a massive impact on the economy
destroying hundreds of thousands of jobs
now the way that this scheme would work
is it would be a monthly handout of
around four hundred and sixty euros to
those who who most need it whether it's
single-parent families or others who are
marginalised from the mainstream economy
it will be paid out at first to around a
hundred thousand homes in Spain and if
that is successful the the policy would
be expanded to up to a million
households across the country now this
has very much been a pet project of the
podemos party a party on the Left which
is the junior partner in the governing
coalition and what they must has
frequently been accused by parties on

Venezuelan style populism and certainly
this proposal for universal basic income

but it does seem as if the government as
a whole is very determined to implement
this and certainly the Socialist Party
of Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is very
much behind it and if all goes to plan
this proposal will be approved by a
cabinet meeting next week and universal
basic income could be introduced in
